Molina Romero, Francesc Xavier
metadata.dc:description: Endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography may be difficult in patients that have undergone Roux-en-Y gastric bypass. Due to the fact that prevalence of morbid obesity is increasing, and laparoscopic procedures for its treatment have increased, the incidence of biliary tract problems in patients of altered anatomy is also growing. We describe a laparoscopic technique to access the biliary tree by endoscope, through the excluded stomach.
metadata.dc:subject: Endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography

metadata.dc:title: Laparoscopic transgastric endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography after biliopancreatic diversion.
